DataElement.preferredName: Prior Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Neoplastic Cell Within Graft Prior Removable Detection Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not tumor cells were detected in the collected cells, before purging prior to the hematopoietic cell transplantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Neoplastic Cell Within Graft Prior Removable Detection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._Cells of, or derived from, a tumor._On the inside; contained in._Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._Earlier in time or order._Capable of being taken away._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Prior Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Neoplastic Cell
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual.:Cells of, or derived from, a tumor.

Concepts.definition: Earlier in time or order.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
Cells of, or derived from, a tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: On the inside; contained in.:Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.:Earlier in time or order.:Capable of being taken away.:No value exists.

Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

Capable of being taken away.
The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping

ReferenceDocuments.name: Were tumor cells detected in
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were tumor cells detected in collected cells, before purging prior to HSCT?

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2749839
ReferenceDocuments.description: "PerformedClinicalResult.value(ANY=>BL) WHERE PerformedClinicalResult > PerformedObservation > DefinedObservation.nameCode = ""test for tumor cells"" AND DefinedObservation.methodCode = {specified method} AND PerformedObservation > Subject > Biologic > PerformedSubstanceExtraction > SubstanceExtractionAdministrationRelationship.relationCode = ""autologous"" AND PerformedObservation.dateRange IS LESS THAN {date of transplant}  {date of transplant} is determiend by: Subject > PerformedSubstanceAdministration.dateRange WHERE PerformedSubstanceAdministration > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = ""Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplant"""

DataElement.changeDescription: . 2021-8-5 ak System generated def displayed as alt def.
